column5: Need spot to take kids today, but have requirements so it is not a super easy find for my area:  -clear water. Looking down at the bobber would be good like they do at ceserea -sunfish, sunfish sunfish, rockbass. enough to keep a kid happy, board kids are no fun. -not strictly fishing. Throwing stones or play at park or quiet spot. So the concrete dock at Ceserea would be a no go. -not in the way of others. So again a boat launch where we have to keep an eye on the kids every cast won't work. being around other kids is good. -30-40 minute drive seems OK. but I have been told that Peterborough is too far.   any good leads?
Well, Peterborough is less than 30 minutes for me...kinda depends where you're starting from.

scugog right beside the Port Perry boat launch.  if you walk North of the ramp on the path there are a bunch of spots you and the kids can fish.  sunfish and perch are all over the place there.  dinks but something for the kids (and you) to enjoy.
I'm guessing he's from the Whitby area based on his name...

Thanks for the replies. The wife snarled and threw the day out of the window so I will be doing my #2 choice of cleaning the garage and arranging fishing stuff. the kids will be doing something else.  I will check out that scugog spot for future reference. thanks.
keep your head up....do your chores....soon you'll be on the water instead of online    like me
quite the splash pad port perry has on the waterfront...
Yes...I have seen it, thanks for the reminder. We have 2 of those in Whitby and I think more are going up elsewhere. Let me tell you, when I was a kid.....
